channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-4387] Instability in KvStateClientTest.testClientServerIntegration()
item.description:
According to this log: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/151491745/log.txt

the KvStateClientTest didn't complete.

"main" #1 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fb2b400a000 nid=0x29dc in Object.wait() [0x00007fb2bcb3b000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	- waiting on <0x00000000f7c049a0> (a io.netty.util.concurrent.DefaultPromise)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:502)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.DefaultPromise.await(DefaultPromise.java:254)
	- locked <0x00000000f7c049a0> (a io.netty.util.concurrent.DefaultPromise)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.DefaultPromise.await(DefaultPromise.java:32)
	at org.apache.flink.runtime.query.netty.KvStateServer.shutDown(KvStateServer.java:185)
	at org.apache.flink.runtime.query.netty.KvStateClientTest.testClientServerIntegration(KvStateClientTest.java:680)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

and

Exception in thread "globalEventExecutor-1-3" java.lang.AssertionError
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.AbstractScheduledEventExecutor.pollScheduledTask(AbstractScheduledEventExecutor.java:83)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor.fetchFromScheduledTaskQueue(GlobalEventExecutor.java:110)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor.takeTask(GlobalEventExecutor.java:95)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor$TaskRunner.run(GlobalEventExecutor.java:226)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.DefaultThreadFactory$DefaultRunnableDecorator.run(DefaultThreadFactory.java:137)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This could be related: https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/4357 If it is related, we could be affected as we are running an older Netty version (4.0.27.Final). I would have to check the stack traces in more detail.

I saw this assertion error also in another test

Exception in thread "globalEventExecutor-1-1" java.lang.AssertionError
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.AbstractScheduledEventExecutor.pollScheduledTask(AbstractScheduledEventExecutor.java:83)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor.fetchFromScheduledTaskQueue(GlobalEventExecutor.java:110)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor.takeTask(GlobalEventExecutor.java:95)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor$TaskRunner.run(GlobalEventExecutor.java:226)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.DefaultThreadFactory$DefaultRunnableDecorator.run(DefaultThreadFactory.java:137)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/152241331/log.txt

But I wonder why this error occurs now. Did we update the netty version recently?
Fixed in f791680 (master). In the newly introduced KvStateServer we were waiting on the termination future, which we don't do in other places. Re-enabled the test again.
Fixed in f791680 (forgot to close the issue before).

uce I saw the same issue in either NonHAQueryableStateRocksDBBackendITCase or HAQueryableStateRocksDBBackendITCase. Wasn't your fix f791680 just a work around that ignore some underlying problem?

https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/341916322/log.txt

-------------------------------------------------------
 T E S T S
-------------------------------------------------------
Running org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.NonHAQueryableStateRocksDBBackendITCase
Running org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.HAQueryableStateRocksDBBackendITCase
Tests run: 12, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 1, Time elapsed: 15.587 sec - in org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.NonHAQueryableStateRocksDBBackendITCase
Tests run: 12, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 1, Time elapsed: 15.888 sec - in org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.HAQueryableStateRocksDBBackendITCase
Exception in thread "globalEventExecutor-1-1" java.lang.AssertionError
	at org.apache.flink.shaded.netty4.io.netty.util.concurrent.AbstractScheduledEventExecutor.pollScheduledTask(AbstractScheduledEventExecutor.java:83)
	at org.apache.flink.shaded.netty4.io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor.fetchFromScheduledTaskQueue(GlobalEventExecutor.java:110)
	at org.apache.flink.shaded.netty4.io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor.takeTask(GlobalEventExecutor.java:95)
	at org.apache.flink.shaded.netty4.io.netty.util.concurrent.GlobalEventExecutor$TaskRunner.run(GlobalEventExecutor.java:226)
	at org.apache.flink.shaded.netty4.io.netty.util.concurrent.DefaultThreadFactory$DefaultRunnableDecorator.run(DefaultThreadFactory.java:137)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Running org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.NonHAQueryableStateFsBackendITCase
Tests run: 12, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 1, Time elapsed: 8.066 sec - in org.apache.flink.queryablestate.itcases.NonHAQueryableStateFsBackendITCase

Hey Piotr, I don't remember this issue in detail. Judging from the commit message you referenced, I agree that it seems to be a work around. Wasn't the queryable state client/server refactored for 1.4 to work over HTTP (still via Netty though)?

Another instance (same stacktrace):
https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/347376886/log.txt

Apparently, this bug was either re-introduced or is still there but less frequent.

GitHub user NicoK opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/5606

FLINK-4387[QS] don't wait and process requests at Netty servers after shutdown request

    1. What is the purpose of the change

There is a race condition on an assertion in Netty's event loop that may cause
tests to fail when finished early.

This was fixed in 4.0.33.Final via https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/4357 but we currently still rely on Netty 4.0.27.Final, hence the bug fix for the tests where this bug can be immanent.

    1. Brief change log
  • in QueryableState tests, do not wait for a "quiet period" for further events to arrive and process, this is not needed here and circumvents the bug
    1. Verifying this change

This change is a trivial rework / code cleanup without any test coverage.

    1. Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:
  • Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): *no*
  • The public API, i.e., is any changed class annotated with `@Public(Evolving)`: *no*
  • The serializers: *no*
  • The runtime per-record code paths (performance sensitive): *no*
  • Anything that affects deployment or recovery: JobManager (and its components), Checkpointing, Yarn/Mesos, ZooKeeper: *no*
  • The S3 file system connector: *no*
    1. Documentation
  • Does this pull request introduce a new feature? *no*
  • If yes, how is the feature documented? *JavaDocs*

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/NicoK/flink flink-4387

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/5606.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #5606

commit 7acd43e9148da218806a43e2b381f84f8106d3ac
Author: Nico Kruber <nico@...>
Date: 2018-03-01T08:43:56Z

FLINK-4387[QS] don't wait and process requests at Netty servers after shutdown request

There is a race condition on an assertion in Netty's event loop that may cause
tests to fail when finished early.

This was fixed in 4.0.33.Final, see https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/4357.

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/5606

Merged on master at 6ad626ae51a157306ddf4165f13ff5eb5b4d5e8b

and on release-1.5 at cc32ffe70b70b926168ea91a7e92f90187dbbe57

Apparently, this is still there in further calls to EventExecutorGroup#shutdownGracefully(), see https://travis-ci.org/apache/flink/builds/348239155. The original bug in Netty indicates that for any real system not immediately shutting down after being started (the typical test scenario) it should not occur.
Upgrading Netty should solve this bug as well.
NicoK Why is this not fixVersion == 1.5 anymore if you reopened?
because it is not fixed - and I'd target this for 1.6 only
NicoK Has this issue already been fixed? I noticed you said this issue could be fixed by upgrading Netty on March 5th.
I think as yunta says, this should have been fixed when Netty was upgraded. Furthermore, the referenced test class does not exist anymore. rmetzger I think we can close this.
Thank you for your assessment. I've closed it.
